plot function

Source: R/plot.ineqx.R
plot.ineqx.Rd

[...]

Usage

# S3 method for class 'ineqx'
plot(ineqx.out, type, yscale = 1)

Arguments

ineqx.out

ineqx.out object from ineqx()

type

Character string. Plot type. Choose from: dMuP, dMuT, dSigmaP, dSigmaT, dWP, dWT, dBP, dBT, dPP, dPT, dT, dPA

yscale

Either 1 or 2. Choose value on y-axis. 1: Effect in units of ystat. 2: Effect as % of value at reference time (ref)

Value

Returns a ggplot2 object

Details

The y-axis can be scaled in two ways:

yscale=1 (default): absolute points of Var or CV2.
yscale=2: % of the value of Var or CV2 at reference time.
(Total Var or CV2 with type="dT" and within-group & between-group Var or CV2 with type="dW" & type="dB", respectively.)

Author

Benjamin Rosche <benjamin.rosche@gmail.com>

Examples

data(incdat)
i1 <- ineqx(y=inc, group=SES, time=year, ref=1, dat=incdat)
#> Error: object 'inc' not found
plot(i1, type="dMuSigma2")
#> Error: object 'i1' not found
